reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when arriving at Heathrow, we jumped on the hopper bus to get to The Hotel - this cost £4 per passenger.
reviews.title: Expensive but otherwise perfect

reviews.text: On the way home, we missed the hopper and had to catch a taxi which cost £20. Therefore make sure you catch the hopper if you want a cheap ride.
reviews.title: New Jurys Inn at Heathrow is a great place to stay!

reviews.text: Ideal hotel, clean, comfortable, quiet location. no problems
reviews.title: 4 Night Business Trip

likes.liked: — Close to the Tube - excellent triple glazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a single night at the new Jurys Inn at Heathrow in June 2008, having booked it based on stays at previous Jurys Inn's in the past. I'm really glad I did!
reviews.title: Great view of concorde

likes.disliked: — not much to do close to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very new, but not so new that it's got that "new paint" smell! Upon arrival, you go to the wide bright reception area, the check-in team were really nice and polite, very professional but wonderfully chatty. The check in process, as with any Jurys Inn, is very quick and easy, and then it was off to the room.
reviews.title: Great Location for Twickenham Event

reviews.text: In general, Jurys is acceptable and it won't kill anyone to stay there for a night. On the plus side, it's very convenient to Heathrow terminal 4 and if you're flying into there in the next few months during the terminal 4/5 construction, you can take a free shuttle bus from the airport to Hatton Cross station which is a five minute easy walk to the hotel. The fact that Hatton Cross is close is another plus; if you have a long-ish layover at Heathrow, the tube is so close to the hotel that you can spend a few hours in London and return withouth the hassle of Heathrow. With other airport hotels, going into Central London is very inconvenient as you have to take the Hotel Hoppa into Heathrow and then find your way through the Heathrow tube maze to make it into the city, and then do the same on the return.
reviews.title: OK, but bring food and a book

reviews.text: Another plus is the price. While other airport hotels were charging upwards of $300 per day, we go the room at Jurys for a little over $120. I know it's even cheaper on some days, but apparently, something was going on around Heathrow which made hotel space tight.
reviews.title: Value overrides any negatives

reviews.text: The hotel is brand new and very well kept. It was clean, the air conditioning worked fine and we heard no noise from the nearby airport.
reviews.title: Hotel was good!

reviews.text: On the negative side..... First, if you're flying into terminals 1, 2 or 3, you'll need to either take the Heathrow Express into terminal 4 and then take the free shuttle bus to Hatton Cross and then walk to the hotel, or alternatively, you can take the Hotel Hoppa straight to the airport. Depending on the amount of bags you're carrying, the first option is actually quicker and cheaper, but the second option is more convenient as it drops you off at the hotel door, rather than Hatton Cross. Either way, the Hotel Hoppa for Jurys, Hoppa9, runs infrequently and I waited nearly an hour for mine to arrive, while Hoppas for Sheraton, Radisson, etc., drove by at frequent intervals.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Very convenient to the Heathrow Airport
Great price and served purpose!
reviews.text: Second, other than industrial-type buildings, there is nothing, zero, around the hotel, although again, Hatton Cross is very close so access to London is easy. However, if you don't want to go into the city, you'll need to accept the fact that you will be stuck at the hotel for your entire stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent option if you're flying from Heathrow. Very near Hatton Cross Tube Station (the stop before Heathrow Terminals on the Picadilly line) - get an Oyster card for the Tube and avoid paying for the Hoppa bus. We had a room for £55 through London Town. Comfortable rooms - fine for one night, maybe a little cramped for more than one. If you don't want to eat in the hotel in the evening or at lunchtime, there's a pub called the Green Man within walking distance (cross the road and down the lane, follow the signposts) with good beer, a good selection of reasonably priced wine and good value pub food - and where you can contemplate the effects of air travel on rural communities from the beer garden or inside the pub. Breakfast in the morning was extra - good selection, all self service (a bit canteen like) definitely preferable to what you would get at the airport.
reviews.title: Good place to stay near Heathrow

reviews.text: Booked for 1 night on business. Despite being a busy hotel there was always 4 or 5 receptionts at any one time. TV screens with live departure details in reception and on TV in rooms. I asked the receptionist about a local pub that I had been recommended by friends. The receptionist handed me the pub's flyer containing their menu- good service.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Polite and quick service in the bar.
reviews.title: Nice price hotel, great location for Terminal 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was comprehensive.
reviews.title: Handy for London

reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location for Heathrow Terminal 4, only 5 - 10 mins cab ride. Room in the hotel was quite big and comfortable with plenty of space and was also very clean. Air traffic was not heard through the well soundproofed windows.
reviews.title: Great Heathrow option

reviews.text: The hotel is only O.K.
reviews.title: Not a big deal
Good new hotel near Heathrow
reviews.text: But my husband and I need to be constantly in contact with our offices, even on vacation, so an efficient internet connection is very important.
A smaller quieter airport hotel, with comfortable beds, friendly helpful staff, and reasonable food & bar prices.
reviews.title: Friendly and quiet

likes.liked: — Decent sized rooms, with large windows and comfy beds
likes.disliked: — Lack of extra facilities in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They only have a small carpark but in the 5 days I stayed I never had a trouble parking.
reviews.title: Basic - no frills hotel

reviews.text: Only a couple of minutes walk from Hatton Cross station.
reviews.title: Good location but rather busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walls between rooms and the corridor are a little thin but I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Great low cost hotel

reviews.text: This is a very basic no frills hotel! They have made the windows very sound proof so you can’t hear the planes at all. It’s a pity they didn’t put a little more into sound proofing between rooms! You can hear everything that goes on next door – not always something you want!!! We were able to change rooms – the staff were at least helpful for that!!
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel screams moderate, it is clean, and run like a boarding house. The beds are a bit hard for my taste but ok, if breakfast is included in your room rate ok but if you have to pay 27.00 USD for it think twice. The hotel is used by many of the airlines as a layover stop for their employees and they are loud and seem to talk at full volume all night which can be easily heard thru the paper thin walls.
reviews.title: Just ok is the best rating I can muster for this hotel.

likes.disliked: — Distance from airport, phones, thin walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another big drawback is the fact that the Hotel Hoppa runs only once an hour to and from the property so if you miss it or the Hoppa is full when it gets to your stop you have to wait for then next one which after a long flight or early in the am is downright painful, not to mention the 40 to 55 minute shuttle ride to/from the hotel. If not timed perfectly the whole thing could actually take you almost 2 hours especially coming from the airport since you don’t really have control over when you get out of the terminal and a cab would cost a wad. Jury’s is so far out it has its own Hoppa because there are no other hotels around it and the Hoppa goes via every terminal before making its long journey to the hotel so if you don’t want to keep seeing the same Samsung hand sign over and over again pick another hotel. Most hotels on the Hoppa lines have pick ups about every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Another giant drawback is the phones in the lobby which management says they have nothing to do with but are aware there is a problem with them. They are the ones with the 800 free phone signs on them so beware and try to avoid them if you can but since the hotel offers no alternative except in room which is very expensive too, it is a bit of a catch 22. I think looking back calling from the room may have been cheaper than paying twice for 1 call. I am sure the 800 rip off phones are all over the UK strategically placed where tourist can be ripped off without recourse. I made an international call and the first time it lets you connect and say hello then cuts you off by way of an abrupt busy signal but still connects long enough to charge you $24.76, then you have to call back and pay $24.76 again so you can actually talk to your family the end result is for a 2 minute call the total charge is $49.52, and try battling with them, it is a huge racket. It happened to the people next to me too so it is definitely set up to chisel extra money out of defenseless travelers. In regards to the phone service it is third world service at first world prices, the service is better in Ecuador. When you try to bypass their system and make the call yourself the phone mysteriously doesn’t work and can’t connect.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All and all if you have no other choice it is a place to sleep that is clean but the semi-hard beds aren’t enough to comfort the pains in the rear the hotel’s drawbacks cause.
reviews.title: Much better this time around...

reviews.text: I would say just ok is the best rating I can muster for this hotel.
reviews.title: Clean Airport Hotel
